qas.question: How old was Popper when he died?
Which cemetery in Vienna received Popper's ashes?
Where are Popper's manuscripts kept now?
Which university has the contents of Popper's library?
At what age did Josefine Anna Popper die?
What did Popper's wife die from?
Whose manuscripts were sent to the University of London?
What university possesses Melitta Mew's library?
When did Klagenfurt University lose its copyrights from the estate?

context: Popper died of "complications of <b6_0>cancer<b6_0/>, pneumonia and kidney failure" in Kenley at the age of <a0_0><b5_0>92<b5_0/><a0_0/> on 17 September 1994. He had been working continuously on his philosophy until two weeks before, when he suddenly fell terminally ill. After cremation, his ashes were taken to Vienna and buried at <a1_0>Lainzer<a1_0/> cemetery adjacent to the ORF Centre, where his wife <a4_0>Josefine Anna Popper<a4_0/> (called ‘Hennie’) had already been buried. Popper's estate is managed by his secretary and personal assistant Melitta Mew and her husband Raymond. <b7_0>Popper's<b7_0/> manuscripts went to the <a2_0>Hoover Institution at Stanford University<a2_0/>, partly during his lifetime and partly as supplementary material after his death. <a3_0><b8_0>Klagenfurt<b8_0/> University<a3_0/> possesses Popper's library, including his precious bibliophilia, as well as hard copies of the original Hoover material and microfilms of the supplementary material. The remaining parts of the estate were mostly transferred to The Karl Popper Charitable Trust. In <b9_0>October 2008<b9_0/> Klagenfurt University acquired the copyrights from the estate.
